Topic.Title: Do not buy weekly or monthly puts

Message.Msg: Tech: my hats off to you on your CMG short. I know a lot of folks who got burnt shorting CMG at $300. My sell signal is when the 100 and 200 day moving day average cross. They haven't yet, but it's just a matter of time. AMZN is a different story. AMZN Is a trading stock if you can figure out where it's headed. Sometimes I can. I write spreads on AMZN, sometimes bull, sometimes bear. AMZN owns the book business. Kindle plays on all tablets, including Apple an Android. Sales tax is a non issue. What is important is whether customers enjoy shopping on AMZN. The answer is yes. I am not sure if AMZN will succeed in the video biz, but it's a fast changing game. I see Amzn going up after earnings. If it does, I'll write a bear spread.

Topic.Title: Do not buy weekly or monthly puts

Message.Msg: And that is the reason it is less likely to work here... Check the CMG board. I was there and made A LOT of money on the fall. But, expectations were very high there. They are low here (just like BIDU). Never underestimate the how rigged this game is...

Message.Title: Pops and Drops
Message.Msg: So here we are in with another quarter report. Here is what the last 4 quarters has given us After 2Q11 - $44 drop After 3Q11 - $64 drop After 4Q11 - $15 drop After 1Q12 - $23 pop Everything is noise except revenue number. I think revenue is going to be fine this quarter so maybe we won't have much of a move either way on pps 3Q12 may hold the most volatility as sales tax taken in two large markets, and a couple of product announcements that may not be well received and yoy comps more challenging.

They could execute prior to any QE announcement and take out all the weak hands on the cheap...

Topic.Title: lots of new bearish gamblers on the board! welcome!

Message.Msg: Actually, the future of mankind lies in independent and self sustaining more localized ecosystems. The systemic risk of the world economy has gone through the roof with globally interconnected real time supply chains. Part of the reason the US will emerge better than virtually anyone else from the mess that will follow over the next two years is our resource advantage in things that matter OVER VERY SHORT PERIODS OF TIME. Not iPods. Very little of what AMZN does. In fact, AMZN's business model will collapse harder than any other in a real systemic shock. Far harder. But, you'll learn the hard way... You'll also find that the closer to the customer that AMZN pushes its inventory, the less the structural cost advantage it has... Couple that with the sales tax loss (and Apple/Google kicking its tail in digital books / media access devices) and you have the recipe for a very fun few years for those of us on this side of the transaction...

Topic.Title: if apple announces a IPAD MINI, amazon will be 180s

Message.Msg: Understand that everyone will buy the AMZN Fire 10", which will sell well until Apple lowers its prices on that. More importantly, watch Apple and Google hit Amazon where it hurts and lower prices across the board on digital content and start promoting iCloud and Play as superior to AMZN's offering. If those two compete aggressively on AMZN's profit center turf (since Apple makes its real money on hardware and Google on advertising), AMZN will be in a world of hurt. Lots of investment in things that won't generate cash for a long time (since sales will not grow as rapidly and thus customer financing for expansion will be lower). Apple and Google need to start going after AMZN's core business since it is going after theirs. As the saying goes, turnabout is fair play. Amazon will feel the pain that retailers felt when it was using a completely bogus tax subsidy to undercut retailers for years...

Topic.Title: Apple miss mostly on iPhones...

Message.Msg: Consumer Electronics sales in Q2 are getting hammered. Apple iPhones sales are down. Microsoft says Xbox sales are down. Amazon includes console sales are part of media sales instead of consumer electronics. Sharp Electronics says sales are down. Best Buy sales are WAY down. EBAY said consumer electronic sales are down 4% Consumer spending contracted for three consecutive months in April, May and June. Amazon's two biggest sales segments are Media and Consumer Electronics. It is looking like a very tough quarter and the new recession is already here. And the biggest factor of all.. I bought ZERO Blu-Rays from Amazon last quarter. Nothing good has been released. Academy awards this year was a joke.

Message.Title: Is scamazon gravity resistant?
Message.Msg: I guess we find out thursday how well the CFO can "manage" the number's to avoid any disappointment. I have to admit though in past qtrs. this dog has indeed managed to dodge the bullet of common sense where valuation & earning's are concerned. Could it be that generous div. amzn sport's? Or maybe the genious of constant cap ex spending, alway's promising bottom line result's in future year's-while current valuation's alway's remain sky high? Maybe it's just the amzn cabal, those close nit institutional holder's that just can't bear to sell because they have faith in amzn's ability to scam, I mean manage earning's? In the meantime we have a very nervous market, weakened consumer, sky high valuation , state sales tax's by year's end[according to sen. reid]& in raw number's a moderate short int. So far it look's like a levitation act the last couple month's. Even if earning's were to beat a few cent's why anybody other than a nervous short would chase at these level's on a pump is beyond me. Some decent support look's to be down around 190 if she start's to crater. The problem is in this market invironment support area's can mean zip once the "MO" kick's in. Very high risk being long going into earning's IMHO!

Topic.Title: Is scamazon gravity resistant?

Message.Msg: AMZN is in fact a giant ponzi scheme. The business model is and has been built on a tax law loophole that is closing as we speak. And even with that tax loophole, AMZN operates at a net loss. What do you think happens when taxes kick in? AMZN the stock is an even bigger ponzi scheme. It's entire history has been marked by its ability to sell stock at ever higher prices in order to fund operations and pay its founder. I now believe that HFT machines, fueled by free FED money, have figured out a method to buy and cancel their trades with each other. These dark pools have the effect of pushing the stock price higher with no actual settlement, and then selling stock at the new "equilibrium" level. It is a giant scam, with no enforcement. Banks are fixing LIBOR. You don't think they are capable of fixing the price of AMZN, illegally?

Message.Title: Amazon Inc. fundamental analysis (325$ target price)
Message.Msg: The company has a significant upward potential. The only doubt in this moment is the management of the 5900 million dollars of cash that the company currently has in cash. These are the main figures of the company Net sales: -2012: 63.6 billions -2014: 102.7 billions Net income: -2012: 584 millions -2014: 2301 millions EPS: -2012: 1.34 -2014: 4.43 Cash per share: -2012: 13.10 dollars per share -2014: 20.68 dollars per share Here is the link with the complete analysis of Amazon.com until 2016 with charts, earnings and cash estimates, users satisfaction numbers... http://tllg.net/X7qW

Topic.Title: Amazon Inc. fundamental analysis (325$ target price)

Message.Msg: I applaud your desire to do a thorough analysis. I suggest you start by building a more detailed model that bounds your projections using top down and bottom up estimates. I think you will find it helps you to finds the naive and unrealistic assumptions. It also helps you to think through the competitive dynamics (likely competitive response from significant players) and how those might affect revenues and margins... For your sake, I hope you are not overly leveraged in your long position. Don't get caught up in the hype. The economics in this next leg are not going to scale as hoped for...

Message.Title: My 2 cents
Message.Msg: AAPL will hit the lower Bollinger Band tomorrow. But I cant touch It until it hits the 200 dma, which is currently $505. Looks like AMZN will also drop after earnings. But the lower BB is $212. Not much of a drop. But the BB are also very narrow. Will they expand? I don't know. 3 months ago I predicted AMZN correctly, but I've been striking out lately as its become very volatile in a tight trading range. I've been thinking about just doing OTM spreads on AMZN, using the BB as a trigger. I can't decide how much out of the money the spread should be. Seems like anything below 200 or above 240 is safe. We shall see.

Topic.Title: Amazon Inc. fundamental analysis (325$ target price)

Message.Msg: Thank you for your recommendation but I have to say that I haven't Amazon shares. I think you've seen in the analysis that I explained how Amazon is increasing towards the overall business diversification to increase profitability. The profit margins on online sales are very small, so even with this the company will be able to multiply their benefit in the coming years due to the greater weight of activities that are not only online sales (following the successful example of the Kindle)
